pal 0.0.9062
  • Reference

List files and directories in a GitHub repository

Source: R/pal-GEN.R
gh_dir_ls.Rd

Lists file and directory names found under rev:path in a GitHub repository.

gh_dir_ls(
  path = "",
  owner,
  name,
  rev = "HEAD",
  recurse = TRUE,
  incl_dirs = TRUE,
  incl_files = TRUE
)

Arguments

path

The path from the repository's root to the desired directory. A path or character scalar.
owner

The repository owner's GitHub user or organization name. A character scalar.
name

The repository name. A character scalar.
rev

The Git revision expression matching the desired Git tree object, e.g. a branch name or another symbolic reference like "HEAD@{yesterday}" or "HEAD~10". A character scalar.
recurse

Whether or not to recurse into subdirectories of path.
incl_dirs

Whether or not to list directories (and subdirectories if recurse = TRUE).
incl_files

Whether or not to list files (also inside subdirectories if recurse = TRUE).

Value

A character vector of paths from the repository root to the files and subdirectories found under rev:path.

Details

Works for both public and private repositories, for the latter you just need to set up a sufficiently authorized GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT).

See also

Other GitHub functions: gh_text_files(), gh_text_file()

Examples

# you can opt-out from directory recursion...
pal::gh_dir_ls(owner = "salim-b",
               name = "pal",
               recurse = FALSE) |>
  pal::cat_lines()

#> .ackrc
#> .gitignore
#> .lintr
#> .Rbuildignore
#> data-raw
#> DESCRIPTION
#> docs
#> inst
#> LICENSE.md
#> man
#> NAMESPACE
#> pal.Rproj
#> pkgdown
#> R
#> README.md
#> README.Rmd
#> Rmd
#> tests
#> TODO.md

# ...or list only files...
pal::gh_dir_ls(path = "tests",
               owner = "salim-b",
               name = "pal",
               incl_files = FALSE) |>
  pal::cat_lines()

#> tests/testthat

# ...or directories
pal::gh_dir_ls(path = "tests",
               owner = "salim-b",
               name = "pal",
               incl_dirs = FALSE) |>
  pal::cat_lines()

#> tests/testthat.R
#> tests/testthat/test-pal.R
